articles.author: FARNOUSH AMIRI and LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Attorney General Merrick Garland on Wednesday is set to come face-to-face with his most ardent critics as House Republicans prepare to use a routine oversight hearing to interrogate him about what they claim is the “weaponization” of the Justice Department under President Joe Biden.
articles.title: Attorney General Garland set to face his GOP critics as Justice Department is under heavy scrutiny

articles.author: JOSEF FEDERMAN and AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is set to have his long-coveted meeting with President Joe Biden on Wednesday — bringing together the two leaders for the first time since the Israeli leader took office at the helm of his country’s far-right government late last year.
articles.title: Israel’s Netanyahu will meet Biden in New York. The location is seen as a sign of US displeasure

articles.author: TARA COPP
articles.description: KANSAS CITY NATIONAL SECURITY CAMPUS, Mo. (AP) — In an ultra-sterile room at a secure factory in Kansas City, U.S. government technicians refurbish the nation’s nuclear warheads. The job is exacting: Each warhead has thousands of springs, gears and copper contacts that must work in conjunction to set off a nuclear explosion.
articles.title: Inside the delicate art of maintaining America's aging nuclear weapons

articles.author: SHEIKH SAALIQ
articles.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — India on Wednesday advised its citizens to be careful when traveling to Canada as a rift between the two nations widens further in the wake of Ottawa’s allegations that India may have been involved in the killing of a Sikh separatist leader in suburban Vancouver.
articles.title: India asks citizens to be careful if traveling to Canada as rift widens over Sikh leader’s death

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israeli military operations in the occupied West Bank and unrest in the Gaza Strip have killed six Palestinians, Palestinian health officials said Wednesday, the latest spike in a wave of violence that has roiled the region for more than a year.
articles.title: Six Palestinians are killed in latest fighting with Israel, at least 3 of them militants

articles.author: AVET DEMOURIAN
articles.description: YEREVAN, Armenia (AP) — Azerbaijan and Armenian forces reached a cease-fire agreement Wednesday to end two days of fighting in the separatist Nagorno-Karabakh region that has been a flashpoint for decades, officials on both sides said.
articles.title: Azerbaijan and Armenian forces reach cease-fire deal for breakaway Nagorno-Karabakh, officials say

articles.author: SAMY MAGDY and YOUSEF MURAD
articles.description: DERNA, Libya (AP) — Abdel-Hamid al-Hassadi survived the devastating flooding in eastern Libya but he lost some 90 people from his extended family.
articles.title: Left behind and grieving, survivors of Libya floods call for accountability

articles.author: MARÍA TERESA HERNÁNDEZ
articles.description: SANTIAGO, Chile (AP) — Soon after she learned what happened, Helmut Kramer’s mother grabbed a pair of scissors and cut the priest out of photographs from her son’s baptism.“She kept the photos after that,” said Kramer, who was sexually abused at age 12 in a Jesuit school in Antofagasta, a city in northern Chile.
articles.title: In Chile, justice eludes victims of Catholic clergy sex abuse years after the crisis exploded

articles.author: ANTHONY IZAGUIRRE
articles.description: ALBANY, N.Y. (AP) — As more than 100,000 migrants arrived in New York City over the past year after crossing the border from Mexico, Mayor Eric Adams and Gov.
articles.title: Biden's Democratic allies intensify pressure for asylum-seekers to get work permits

articles.author: JEFF AMY
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — Marc Tyler Nobleman was supposed to talk to kids about the secret co-creator of Batman, with the aim of inspiring young students in suburban Atlanta's Forsyth County to research and write.
articles.title: A Batman researcher said 'gay' in a talk to schoolkids. When asked to censor himself, he quit
